I?B? degradation and NF-?B activation (or NF-?B nuclear translocation) were observed at 20 to 60 min in Hyal-2 cells post TNF stimulation, but at the 20 min time point in both control and Hyal-1 cells (Fig.

Exogenous bovine testicular hyaluronidase PH-20 stimulates rapid activation of c-Jun N -terminal kinases (JNK1 and JNK2) in L929 cells [ 16 ] . In contrast, the stably expressed Hyal-1 and Hyal-2 could not mediate constitutive activation of JNK1 and JNK2 in L929 cells (data not shown).

PH-20 induces the expression of proapoptotic p53 [ 9 ] and WOX1 (WW domain-containing oxidoreductase; also known as WWOX or FOR) [ 10 ] , which contributes to the increased TNF cytotoxic effect.
To determine whether TGF-?1 blocked Hyal-1 and Hyal-2-increased TNF killing, the cells were pretreated with TGF-?1 for 2 hr and then exposed to TNF-? in the continued presence of TGF-?1 for 16-24 hr.
This correlates with the greater extent of Hyal-2 enhancement of TNF killing compared to Hyal-1.

Testicular hyaluronidase PH-20 counteracts TGF-?1-induced TNF-resistance in L929 cells [ 8 ] . The goal of the present study was to examine whether lysosomal Hyal-1 and Hyal-2 enhance TNF cytotoxic function and counteract TGF-?1-mediated TNF-resistance in L929 cells.
Whether Hyal-2 enhances the apoptosis-inducing function of WOX1 was determined.

In contrast, TGF-?1 protects L929 cells from TNF cytotoxicity by upregulating the expression of antiapoptotic TIAF1, TIF2 and a novel matrix protein [ 11 12 13 14 ] . TGF-?1 blocks PH-20-increased TNF susceptibility [ 15 ] . Likewise, PH-20 inhibits TGF-?1-induced TNF-resistance [ 15 ] . TGF-?1 suppresses PH-20-mediated ERK activation [ 16 ] ; however, the ERK activation is not related with PH-20-increased TNF susceptibility in L929 cells [ 15 ] . Whether the proapoptotic p53 and WOX1 block the function of antiapoptotic TIAF1 and TIF2 is not known.

TGF-? family proteins, including ?1,?2 and ?3, induce TNF-resistance and suppress the PH-20 effect of increasing TNF cytotoxicity in murine L929 fibroblasts [ 8 11 ] . TGF-?1 induces a novel extracellular matrix protein that prevents TNF-mediated cell death and blocks the activation of extracellular signal-regulated kinase (ERK; also known as p42/44 mitogen-activated protein kinase, p42/44 MAPK) in L929 cells [ 8 12 ] . Additionally, TGF-?1 induces the expression of TIAF1 (TGF-?-induced antiapoptotic factor) [ 13 ] and TIF2 (TGF-?-induced factor 2) [ 14 ] that inhibit TNF cytotoxicity.

These results are similar to the bovine testicular PH-20-increased TNF cytotoxicity of L929 cells [ 15 ] .
